release.action: Fixed stop problem when a stage is in debug mode: set timeout to 1h (instead of infinite).
Changed initial java.home to optionally remove the tailing /jre. This fixes a problem on Mac OS when invoking Java command line tools like jar.
Print an error message if pustfix editor is started.
Print uptime in days if it's more than 48 hours.
Added an uptime field to stool status.
Fixed synchronization issue in LockManager shutdown hook.
Validate now detects stale locks and optionally repairs them.
Allow unauthenticated http://dashboard/stages requests.
Add java8-sdk as an alternative package dependency (to fix install problem with OpenJdk from PPA).
Service wrapper: don't restart on OutOfMemory, the user should have a look instead.
Improved stale backstage wiper: invoke stop with proper user (and improved error message); wipe backstages without anchor file.
Fixed "devel" version number in exception mails from dashboard.
stool create: Fixed "Artifact x:y:z not found" error message to include the underlying Maven problem (in particular "Unauthorized").
Fixed missing date in history command.
Fixed lost exception when probing svn checkouts.
Fixed missing stool function in non-login shells.
Fixed missing vhosts in global config.json.
Fixed run/users/root with empty prompt - 'service stool <cmd>' no longer creates this file.
Fixed group permissions for backstage/shared/ssl/tomcat.p12.
Fixed NPE for predicate with unknown property or field; issue proper error message instead.
Fixed exception emails.
'stool start' now reports an error if the hostname name cannot be resolved. And pinging the application has a 5 minutes timeout now.
Changed the port command to separate application and port by '=' (indead of ':').
Fixed Stool 3.2.x upgrade code to properly migrate ports of workspaces, special ports, and suffixes in global defaults.
Generalized suffixes: if a suffix contains [], the resulting application url is the suffix with [] substituted by hostname:port.
Fixed duplicate -autorechown/-autorestart options in dashboard refresh.
Moved stage property description from the config command to the documentation (man stool-config).
Improved documentation.
Renamed overview to dashboard.
Added '-autostop', '-autorestart', '-autochown' and '-autorechown' options for all stage commands.

'stool refresh': Removed implicit re-chowning and re-starting. If you need this functionality, invoke 'refresh' with the new auto options for stage commands: use 'stool refresh -autorechown -autorestart' to get the old behavior.
'stool remove': Removed implicit stopping. If you need this functionality, invoke 'stool remove -autostop'.
Adjusted the 'chown' command for the new '-autorestart' options: 'chown' now reports an error, if the stage is up. Use '-autorestart' to get the old behavior. The old '-stop' option is gone.
Removed the 'build -restart' option, use '-autorestart' instead.
Updated default tomcat version from 7.0.57 to 8.0.26.
Fixed permission problem on Fitnesse log files; all output is written to backstage/shared/tomcat/logs/fitnesse.log now.
Retry ldap query if an CommunicationException occured.
Fitnesse extension: Fixed NPE during stage stop when fitnesse is enabled while tomcat is running.
Fixed tomcat.perm configuration.

@proxyOpts@ is a normal macro now, and it is no longer computed from the stage owner's environment. If you need proxy configuration, you defined it in the global configuration and adjust your stage defaults to use it for all stages.
Removed Stool update-checks, the packaging system is responsible for this now.
'stool config' now supports a "{}" place holder to refer to the previous value. You can use this e.g. to append to a property: 'stool config "tomcat.opts={} -Dfoo=bar".
Fixed exception if history argument is not a number. Issue proper error message now.

You can create artifact stages from either gav: or file: urls now. Example: 'stool create file:///path/to/my.war'. You can specify multiple comma-separates urls (instead of the previous multiple coordinates within one gav url).
Improved setup: Debian package is configurable with debconf now, and it's separated into a stool and a stool-dashboard package now.
Changed the 'suffix' stage property to 'suffixes', it holds a list now.

Improved locking (i.e. less waiting for lock messages): replace the old global- and stage-semaphores by one global read/write lock, and per-stage a backstage read/write lock and a directory read/write lock.
'stool restart': remove 5 seconds sleep.
Simplified cwd handling: only the following commands change the current directory: create, remove, select and cd.
Removed allowLinking in server.xml. Because it's no longer needed for Controlpanel and the configuration differs between Tomcat 7 and Tomcat 8.
Fixed wrong capitalization in server.xml for element host alias.
Merged all {stage}/ports files into one {home}/run/ports file.
Support stages with empty MAVEN_HOME: Stool includes ${home}/maven-settings.xml now, they are used to resolve dependencies if the current user has no MAVEN_HOME.
The separator for list property values is "," now, space is no longer supported.
'stool config': Display properties as strings, not as json objects.
The 'tomcat.env' property is a map now, it defines the environment for applications. (Because the old white-listing is hard to debug and problematic when starting an application as a different user.)
Removed the global 'errorTool' property, report problems to configured 'adminEmail' instead.
'stool select': Fixed illegal argument exception if the use specified an absolute path instead of stage name.
Removed global 'portOverview' property.
Fix persistent ldap connection problem in overview.
Renamed user "servlet" to "stool".
Changed permission for stool files from 666 to 664.
Properly set setgid bit for home directory and every stage directory.
Moved $STOOL_HOME/conf/overview.properties to $STOOL_HOME/overview.properties.
Renamed $STOOL_HOME/wrappers to $STOOL_HOME/backstages.
Renamed $STOOL_HOME/conf to $STOOL_HOME/run.
Manual pages for all commands. puc help no longer contains command details, use man stool-<command> instead.
import: Fixed error message when argument is not a directory.
Overview: Moved log output into tomcat/logs/overview.log.
History command: support multiple details argument with ranges.

History command: properly handle overlapping commands. To implement this i had to fix the log file format: id is unique accross file now, because a command started before midnight may finish the next day.
stool -exception throws an intentional exception now. To test error tool.
Source stages: properly detect web application directory even if they have now web.xml.
Improved verbose output when acquiring locks.
Overview: Fix dead action buttons after console window was closed.
Overview: Fix console window spinner to properly detect finished commands.

stool.properties: Renamed 'downloads' property to 'downloadCache'. Added stool properties downloadTomcat and downloadServiceWrapper to configure download urls. As a side effect, Stool can now properly download Tomcat 8. Also improved console output for downloads and error messages.
Added optional $home/run/overview.properties file to configure svn credentials for overview when it invokes Stool.
Added global -svnuser and -svnpassword options.
Added @svnCredentials@ and @stoolSvnCredentials@ macros to properly configure refresh commands.
Incremental upgrade refreshes overview now.
Build Debian packages.
Improved expiration messages and emails.
Fix missing svn update when refreshing a source stage.
Fix foreign start problem with enabled editor.
Fix "-fail after" to properly handle ArgumentExceptions.
Added -suspend option for stool refresh and restart.
Shrink application file by 1) calling pommes as an external executable, and 2) dumping svnkit,
Added explicit properties for system-import.
Removed time from until dates. Technically, they are Java 8 LocalDate instances now.
Added \\= placeholder for global prompt property.
Moved home/sessions to home/conf/users

Moved home/stool.aquire and home/sleep.json to home/conf/stool.lock and home/conf/sleep.json to fix security problems: the home directory cannot be group writeable, otherwise, every group member can move away the bin directory an replace it with his own directory.
Compile Stool for Java 8.
Update spring-security dependencies from 4.0.0.RC to 4.0.0.RELEASE.
Replaced 'security' property by 'shared' and 'committed' properties.
Removed role handling, we no longer need it.
Fixed stool-function for none-bash shells.
Fixed install "security" config parameter.
Added tomcat.env property to explicitly define the environment for running apps.
Configurable downloads.
Cleanup sudo stuff to simplify sudoers and fix known security problems.
Moved stool-function into bin directory.
overview/go can address individual apps of one stage now.
Dumped hijacked owner. Instead, overview now invokes sudo -u user stool-raw.sh
Fixed log file permissions after roll-over.
Fixed history to include archived logs.
Added a unique id to the stage status.
Dumped stage specific stool logs. Instead the global stool log contains stage info now.
Moved shared/applogs to shared/tomcat/logs/applogs
Added mode and logroot context parameter to Pustefix extension.
Moved Pustefix Editor code into a new PustefixEditor extension.
Added extensions.
Fixed incremental upgrade to add a new stool jar and modify a symlink.
Fixed autoRefresh: the timer task's log directory was wrong.
Fixed port allocation: it was possible to get the same port twice for on stage.

Updating with setup-stool no longer updates the overview war. Because it only updated the war file but never the unpacked ROOT directory was never replaced. Instead it prints how to refresh the overview.
Added "batch" option for setup-stool.
Overview stage has to be "reserved".
Fix stool create: refuse create a stage under wrappers.
Fix missing group-write permission of $stage/log and $stage/tomcat.
Fix userdata configuration for pustefix editor.
Wrapper was always started with Stool's java version. Now, it's started with the Java version specified for the stage.
Dumped state "crashed", it's no longer useful since service wrapper is very robust. And allows for some nice optimizations because I can move "ps aux" calls into the validate command.
Fixed hostname in generated certificates.
Fixed status output for empty lists.
Fixed NPE in changes file.
Fix create wrapper problem when creating a workspace.
Fix missing default tomcat opts in stage overview.
'create' now ensures the execute permission on all ancestors.
Generalized selection options: -all-state and -all-owner are gone, you can express this the -stage option now. Examples: "-stage state=up" or "-stage owner!=mlhartme+state=down"
Status improvements: added 'state' field; change field 'tomcat' and 'debug' to be port numbers or null; renamed status field 'jconsole' to 'jmx', it contains full jconsole and jvisualvm commands now.
Added maven.home property to configure maven.
Fixed stool config for boolean values.
Added support for Pustefix editor: stool config pustefix.editor=true ; stool restart
Fixed debugger field in stool status.
Moved overview logs from $HOME/logs/overview to the wrapper/shared/log to fix permission problems when chowning the overview stage.
Improved import: the name is configurable now. And if import fails, you can retry, possibly with a different name.
Fixed update-check to respect proxy settings.
Overview now invokes stale wrapper wiper before gathering stages.
Removed resolve command, it was never used.
Updated Maven Embedded to fix pom loading problem.
Replaced Pustefix samples by Hello War samples.
Status for selected fields.
Removed 'updateSource' from global config - updates are hard-wired to Github now.
Moved project to Github; changed groupId and packages to net.oneandone.
Open/close commands are gone, if Stool is available in your shell, you can use it right away. The stage indicator in your shell prompt is only visible if you have a stage selected.
Every webapp has it's own port now, thus you don't need vhost and appropriate dns * entries to run Stool. Added a global 'vhosts' option to configure whether you want stage urls with vhosts or not.

Reworked setup-stool: it's a normal command now that installs or upgrades Stool at the specified location. The former system-install command is gone. Added system-import command. The former Stool function is generated by setup, and it works for none-bash shells now.

Switched to Java service wrapper to control Tomcat. The service wrapper version is configurable in the stage configuration. A service wrapper is more robust, e.g. it properly stops tomcats when the machine is shut down.
Stale wrapper wiper: Stool automatically (on every invocation) detects and removes wrappers whose directory has been deleted.
Removed support for repository stages.
Replaced workspace stages by generalized war stages. Renamed war stages to source stages.
Port prefixes are gone, all ports except for the overview stage, are generated now. The global configuration specifies ports now, not prefixes.
Send RuntimeException to ErrorTool (if errortool url is configured).
Fixed per-stage logging, it used to work only for the selected stage.
Added an update check to inform user about new Stool releases.

Improved failure modes: they also apply to the stage command itself now. For example, if you start all stages with failure mode 'after', a startup failure for the first stage does not prevent the second stage to be started. And: failure mode 'before' was renamed to 'normal'.
Simplified name and directory defaults in Create.
Improved default name when creating artifact stages: pick the artifactId from the url.
Stop on a sleeping stage puts it in state stopped now.

Tomcat base is created once now, with a server.xml.template stripped from comments. This allows for manual configuration changes because Stool no longer overwrites them with the next start command. Starting an application generates a fresh server.xml from this template.
Added start -suspend option to wait for a debugger to connect.
Moved monitoring code into separate application.
Removed support for patched Tomcats from ivar. If you need a patched Tomcat, create an tar.gz file an place it in the downloads directory.
Removed global 'stages' property. There's no need to have all stages under one specific directory.
Renamed global 'autoremove' property to 'autoRemove'.
Removed 'version' from global settings, it's redundant.
Replaced "stool run" by "stool start -tail", which is more robust and more natural for having a service wrapper.
Added system-validate command.
Fixed console output - it was not printed until the newline was sent, which was confusing when the line asks for input.
Removed hard-coded pfixpublisher.
Quick imports - if only a single candidate is found, it's imported and selected without interaction.
Stage overview port has it's own global 'portOverview' property now.
Removed sharedBin from stage config.
Overview is created during install now, in directory STOOL_HOME/overview.
Updated default tomcat version 7.0.39 to 7.0.57.
